meta.title: Love Eat Keep Fit — Research Group
meta.description: Join a research group to test a sustainable, neuroscience-informed weight loss method. No dangerous diets. Eat well, enjoy food, lose fat.

hero.title: Hi, I’m Lana.
hero.subtitle: I'm a food coach who helps you transform your grocery shopping and cooking routine into a sustainable, healthy lifestyle — without spending hours in the kitchen or eating boring food. You can cook for your entire family and still hit your fitness goals, even on a calorie deficit. After years of experimenting with cooking, weight management, and working with nutritionists, I've identified the pain points we all struggle with on our weight control journey — and found science-based answers on how to prevent your brain and body from sabotaging you. I'll show you how to get the nutrients you need to avoid cravings and overeating habits that derail weight loss. Plus, I offer motivational support groups and individual coaching — because accountability is often the hardest part when you're on your own in your weight management journey.

story.heading: If any of these sounds like you…
story.short: It’s not willpower. It’s the daily friction around food.
story.intro: If so, you're not alone. Maybe you need more motivation or accountability, but that's not the real problem. You need a system that actually fits real life. Diets do not work. Lifestyle changes do: new habits around food, a new way to organize your cooking, and new knowledge about food composition and how it affects us when approached improperly.

painPoints.title: Meal plan burnout
painPoints.description: You start strong, then fall off because cooking and grocery shopping take too much time and energy.

painPoints.title: Life on pause
painPoints.description: It feels like you have to put your life on hold just to organize food for your goals.

painPoints.title: Bland food fatigue
painPoints.description: Diets feel boring, so you slide back into fast food or sweets.

painPoints.title: No grocery system
painPoints.description: You’re unsure how to plan groceries and end up at the shop every second day.

painPoints.title: Calorie overload
painPoints.description: Tracking feels overwhelming — one more task on your to-do list.

painPoints.title: Reset cycle
painPoints.description: You do well for a week, then life happens and everything resets.

painPoints.title: Protein without meat
painPoints.description: You don’t eat meat and struggle to hit your protein needs.

painPoints.title: No-workout preference
painPoints.description: You’re not into sport and want results without crazy workouts.

story.bridge: These aren’t personal failures — they’re design problems. Most plans ignore how busy life is and how your brain reacts to restriction.
story.solutionHeading: A system that fits real life
story.solution: Believe me, I was there. I know every pain on this list and more. That’s why I built a system that makes healthy eating simple, grocery shopping quick, food tasty, and weight-goal management sustainable long term. It fits into a busy lifestyle.

coreOffer.heading: What my coaching gives you
items: Personal accountability that keeps you consistent
Supportive community plus 1:1 guidance when you need it
Simple cooking routines with quick, tasty recipes
A grocery system that saves time and reduces stress
Sustainable weight management without restriction or guilt
Macro and calorie guidance tailored to your goals

whatWeDo.heading: Inside the coaching
items: Calculate your daily calorie needs based on your lifestyle and activity.
Learn what macros are and why they matter with simple tools.
Manage cravings and understand your body’s signals.
Ready‑made shopping lists to shop in 5 minutes.
Sustainable workouts that don’t drain your energy.
Exercise is NOT required: you can walk, do light activity, or no exercise — but without movement you’ll eat a bit less and increasing metabolism is harder without muscle or cardio.
Main goal: increase your metabolism, not slow it down.
